intro: Jambolifera laevis, commonly known as the smooth jambolai, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain smooth, kidney-shaped seeds. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a velvety texture. Jambolifera laevis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine.
